args: Some time after Yukimura arrived at the village
Yep! Still brooding. Thought it might help\nto leave him be for a bit, but no change.
Well, it's bad for him to just sit there\ndooming and glooming all day, so time\nfor Yuki to do what Yuki does best!
Heyooo, Izumo! Let's go try something\nnew today, bud! You're gonna LOVE IT!

Ack! Don't sneak up on me like that!
Besides, there's no point in my attempting
anything new when I can't make a simple
rain dance work.
SURE there's a point! Besides, everybody\nfails from time to time—the secret is to\nnot let it get you down.
If you keep trying things, you're bound\nto find something you can succeed at—\nand that's a HARDCORE Yukimura promise!
*sigh* You are as headstrong as ever,\nLady Yukimura.

That's 'cause I only know one way to do
things—ALL IN, BABY! ...Though I bet a
smart kid like you has a few things to
say about that approach.
Anyway, I'm sure we can find something\nout there that's better than sitting here\nfeeling low, so let's go find it together!
Well, I suppose I am a bit weary of sitting\nhere feeling sorry for myself...
So because of that—and also because\nI respect you as a Wyrmclan leader—\nI agree to your proposal.
Er, but what are we doing, exactly?
Why don't we try helping out around the\nvillage? It'll get you up and moving,\nplus repay them for all their kindness!
All right. Let's see who needs our help.
...That's very kind of you to offer. As it\nhappens, I need help tending the fields.
It's been so dry lately that we have to\nwater everything by hand, and we just\ndon't have enough people. Can you help?
Of course. Please tell me what to do.
I've filled this pail with well water, so just\nuse a ladle to sprinkle it over the crops.
That seems simple enough. I just take this\nbucket and—HUUURRRRRRKKKK!
...It's too heavy. I can't lift it.

Huh? Here, let me try. ...Huuuurk!
Okay, yeah, it's heavy, but it's not some
kind of magical immovable object or
something.
I hardly ever had to lift a finger when I\nwas in the palace, let alone water pails.\nI'm just not used to this.
But what about the Eight-span Mirror?\nOr your lance? Those are heavy, yeah?
Those were blessed by Amaterasu,\nwhich made them light as a feather.
Really? Wow, that's a deal. Okay, well,\nhow about I carry the pail around while\nyou sprinkle the water?
I'm so sorry. You did the lion's share of\nthe work out there. It probably would have\ngone faster without me, honestly.
Eh, don't sweat it! Let's just regroup\nand move on to the next thing.
Our next job is to help sweep and clean\nthe fronts of people's homes. I'm fairly\ncertain even I can handle a broom.
That's the spirit! Get a good grip on it\nand start sweeping those leaves away!
So I move the broom like this and\nsweep the leaves to the side like so...
Er, Lady Yukimura? Whenever I try to\nsweep these leaves into a pile, they wind\nup getting even...more scattered?
Holy crap, you are TERRIBLE at this!\nEr, I mean, it's just because you're not\nused to your broom! Yeah, that's it...
You're probably too tense. Loosen up\nyour shoulders a bit and take it easy.\nThat should fix the problem.
Loosen up my shoulders...\nTake it easy...
I'm sorry. You're right. I'm a total failure\nwhen it comes to sweeping.
D-don't worry about it! I've got this!
NOOOOOO! If you pour oil on that,\nit's gonna EXPLOOOODE!
...So a purification ritual ISN'T enough\nto clean a bathroom?!
...Oh no! I made it even MORE dirty!\nI'm so sorry, everyone!
Please don't look so down, emissary.\nWe're just happy you offered to help.

Because Izumo's attendants did everything for him
at the palace, his lack of knowledge about the
world around him turned his offers of help into a
series of abject failures. And as a result...
*sob* I'm useless! If you look up ＂useless＂\nin a dictionary, you'll see my useless face!
Everyone told me it was the thought that\ncounted, but that just made it WORSE!
Oh, c'mon! Don't let it get to you!\n...Although I gotta admit, I absolutely\nsee where you're coming from.
But that only means your hard work hasn't\npaid off, not that you're useless. So just\nkeep at it and I know you'll find something!
I appreciate the kind words, but I fear\nI simply can't believe them.
Well, I believe that you'll succeed. I mean,\nyou were just one step away from being\nable to do most of what you tried, right?
I don't understand why you're trying so\ndesperately to cheer me when I'm\npractically a stranger to you.
Is it because I'm an emissary of\nLady Amaterasu?
Nope! That's got nothing to do with it.
Because I used to mess up all the dang\ntime, and it always made me happy when\nsomeone tried to comfort me.

See, I used to be just like you. Nobody
would let me do anything, which meant
I didn't KNOW anything and couldn't do
diddly-squat.
So when I decided to be like General\nShingen, I messed up ALL THE TIME.
I was super broken up about it, but each\ntime, General Shingen would be there to\nlift my spirits—and I mean EVERY time.
Thanks to him, I was able to overcome\nmy failures and move forward toward a\nbrighter future.

So yeah, that's why I'm cheering you on.
You're trying to change from someone who
can't do anything to someone who can,
and I'll be there every step of the way.
Which is why I feel unable to refuse\nwhen you offer to help me.
Yes. I want to try again. As you said,\nI could just be one step away from being\nable to accomplish something.
So I'm going to believe in that.
Right-o! Next up, we help make dinner!
I borrowed a recipe that seems easy\nenough, but I haven't ever wielded a\nknife before, so I'm a bit nervous.
Eh, I'm sure it'll be fine! The villagers said\nit was just a simple soup, right?
Though, uh, every time I try to make soup\nit kinda sorta explodes, so I'm just gonna\ncheer you on from waaaaay back here.
Well, now I'm even MORE nervous...\nBut all right. According to the instructions,\nI need to wash the ingredients first.
Good, that's done. Now I have to put things\non a cutting board and start chopping.
I'm supposed to...curl my fingers over the\nfood while I use the knife? Ah, of course.\nSo I don't cut myself. That makes sense.
Yes! I did it! ...Er, but the size of the\npieces are all over the map.
Hey, mismatched shapes just make it fun\nto eat! Besides, cooking is all about the\nlove you put into it, yeah?
In that case, I won't let it upset me.\nNow I put everything into the hot water...
Lastly, I have to season it. Let's see...\nSome soy sauce, some salt, and some\ndashi broth should be just the ticket.

So, um, what do you think, Lady Yukimura?
I thought it would smell like a trash heap,
but I'm actually sort of proud at how it
seems to have turned out.
Back up, bub! I'm a PRO at taste-testing!\n*slurp* ...HUUUUURK!
THIS IS AMAZINGLY INCREDIBLE AAAAAH!\nYOU'RE SO GOOD AT COOKING!

OF COURSE! THAT'S WHY I'M YELLING!
Oh my gosh, you actually DID it, Izumo!
You found something you're great at!
Congratulations, buddy!
I gotta let all the villagers know how\namazing your cooking is!
Lady Yukimura, wait! You don't have to\ntell every... Too late. She's gone.
But I still can't believe it. I did something\nother than my duties as Lady Amaterasu's\nemissary. It feels like a dream.
I think I've actually taken a step toward\na better future today!
